item.title: Amundi 预计欧洲央行将再减息两次，即使交易员打赌欧洲央行已经减息完毕
item.description: Amundi SA 首席投资官表示，由于经济增长可能依然乏力，欧洲央行将再降息两次。【原文：The European Central Bank will cut interest rates two more times as economic growth is likely to remain lackluster, according to Amundi SA’s chief investment officer.】

item.title: 投资者质疑销量和估值飙升，特斯拉转向机器人领域
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）可能正试图将特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Elon Musk may be trying to pivot Tesla Inc. away from electric vehicles and toward humanoid robots, but to skeptical investors there’s no hiding from its stagnating sales and eye-watering stock market valuation that leaves little room for error.】

item.title: 交易员锁定美联储押注，连续四周推升国债
item.description: 在周四的失业救济数据巩固了美联储下周将降息的预期后，国债将把涨势延续到第四周。【原文：Treasuries were set to extend their rally into a fourth week after Thursday’s jobless claims data cemented expectations the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates next week.】

item.title: 华尔街预计风险最高股票的反弹将持续 12 个月
item.description: 罗素 2000 指数（Russell 2000）是市场上一些风险最高的股票的所在地，该指数一路高歌猛进，华尔街的许多策略师都说，这轮涨势才刚刚开始。【原文：The Russell 2000, home to some of the riskiest stocks on the market, has been on a tear — and a spate of Wall Street strategists say the rally is just getting started.】

item.title: 瑞士法律草案允许私营部门帮助乌克兰重建
item.description: 瑞士政府希望允许更多私营公司参与乌克兰的重建工作。【原文：The Swiss government wants to allow more private companies to get involved in the reconstruction of Ukraine.】

item.title: 纳格尔说：欧盟银行监管机构必须大胆简化规则
item.description: 一位致力于简化规则框架的高级官员表示，欧洲当局应拿出勇气，努力减轻银行的监管负担，同时又不削弱银行的抗风险能力。【原文：European authorities should show courage in their efforts to reduce the regulatory burden on banks without undermining their resilience, according to a top official working on simplifying the rules framework.】

item.title: 印度计划在中国边境附近修建价值 34 亿美元的铁路线
item.description: 印度将通过增加铁路基础设施来加强其东北边境，以深化交通、加快物流并确保军事准备，以防与邻国中国的热络关系再次出现问题。【原文：India is set to reinforce its northeastern frontier by adding railway infrastructure to deepen access, accelerate logistics and ensure military readiness in case warming ties with neighboring China falter again.】

item.title: 需求疲软，债券销售放缓，中国信贷扩张放缓
item.description: 由于融资需求持续疲软，而政府为基础设施投资等支出提供的借贷减少，8 月份中国的信贷增长速度较一年前有所放缓，贷款扩张速度低于预期。【原文：China’s credit growth slowed from a year ago in August with its loan expansion falling short of forecasts, as demand for financing stayed soft while the government borrowed less to fund spending such as infrastructure investment.】

item.title: 土耳其投资者在法院对反对党作出裁决前惶惶不安
item.description: 土耳其股市有望创下 2 月份以来最长的单周连跌记录，投资者在该国主要反对党领导权的另一场法庭争夺战前惶惶不可终日。【原文：Turkish stocks are on track for their longest weekly losing streak since February, with investors on edge ahead of yet another court battle over the leadership of the country’s main opposition party.】

item.title: 中国需求无回升迹象，天然气市场为供应过剩做好准备
item.description: 在米兰举行的一次重要行业会议上，全球天然气贸易商对中国买家的需求何时甚至是否会反弹尚未达成明确共识。【原文：Global gas traders are leaving a major industry conference in Milan without a clear consensus on when — or even if — demand from Chinese buyers will rebound, a key risk as liquefied natural gas supplies keep piling up.】

item.title: 英国通胀预期创两年新高令英国央行头疼不已
item.description: 英国家庭的通胀预期达到了两年来的最高水平，这使英格兰银行在控制物价压力的斗争中遭遇挫折。【原文：UK households’ inflation expectations hit the highest level in two years, a setback for the Bank of England in its battle to keep price pressures under control.】

item.title: 花旗称日本 5500 亿美元美国基金或将推动小型外汇协议的达成
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）分析师称，作为日本与美国关税协议一部分的 5,500 亿美元投资基金可能会大量动用这个亚洲国家 1.3 万亿美元的货币储备。【原文：The $550 billion investment fund that formed part of Japan’s tariff deal with the US may draw heavily on the Asian nation’s $1.3 trillion currency reserves, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 特朗普抨击的数字税得到法国法院支持
item.description: 受到硅谷和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普批评的法国数字服务税赢得了国家宪法法官的支持。【原文：France’s tax on digital services, criticized by Silicon Valley and US President Donald Trump, won the backing of the nation’s constitutional judges.】

item.title: 美国银行称投资者支持美联储在降息时机上的可信度
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的迈克尔-哈特内特（Michael Hartnett）表示，金融市场押注美联储在开始降低借贷成本时仍将 "领先曲线"。【原文：Financial markets are betting the Federal Reserve will still be “ahead of the curve” when it starts lowering borrowing costs, according to Bank of America Corp.’s Michael Hartnett.】

item.title: 罗布-卡普兰谈美联储、人工智能以及全球化如何在没有美国的情况下发生
item.description:
为什么前达拉斯联储主席认为降息50个基点不太可能？【原文：

Why the former Dallas Fed president sees a 50 bps cut as unlikely.

】

item.title: 罗布-卡普兰谈美联储、人工智能和全球化
item.description: 罗布-卡普兰谈美联储、人工智能和全球化【原文：Rob Kaplan on the Fed, AI, and Globalization】

item.title: 荷兰养老基金 PFZW 授予 Robeco 176 亿美元的委托权
item.description: 荷兰养老基金 PFZW 刚刚从贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：PFZW, a Dutch pension fund that’s just pulled large equity mandates from BlackRock Inc. and AQR Capital Management, is awarding a major contract that includes credit to Robeco Institutional Asset Management.】

item.title: Pimco 认为印度将继续维持利率不变，因为通胀接近底部
item.description: 太平洋投资管理公司董事总经理兼亚洲投资组合经理斯蒂芬-张（Stephen Chang）表示，印度央行不太可能降息，因为通胀有触底反弹的迹象。【原文：India‘s central bank is unlikely to cut interest rates as inflation shows signs of bottoming out, Stephen Chang, managing director and Asia portfolio manager at Pacific Investment Management Co., said.】

item.title: 美国寻求撤销对印度制药公司高管的芬太尼指控
item.description: 美国检察官以证据不足为由，要求法官撤销对一名印度制药公司高管涉嫌贩运芬太尼的指控。【原文：US prosecutors have asked a judge to drop charges related to alleged fentanyl trafficking against an Indian pharmaceutical executive, citing insufficient evidence to move forward with the case.】

item.title: 微软团队和解方案结束欧盟滥用调查
item.description: 在欧盟接受了微软公司就其 Teams 视频会议应用程序涉嫌非法捆绑调查做出的和解承诺后，微软公司避免了巨额反垄断处罚。【原文：Microsoft Corp. avoided a hefty antitrust penalty after the European Union accepted its commitments to settle a probe into the alleged illegal bundling of its Teams video-conferencing app.】

item.title: 印尼可能向国有银行追加 120 亿美元注资
item.description: 印尼新任财政部长表示，除了上周五批准的 120 亿美元注资外，他还可能向国有银行注入更多现金。贷款机构的股票纷纷上涨。【原文：Indonesia’s new finance minister signaled he could add more cash to state-owned banks on top of the $12 billion injection approved on Friday. Lenders’ stocks rallied.】

item.title: 英国 7 月经济停滞不前，预算案前阻力重重
item.description: 由于消费者和企业面临加税和关税带来的不利因素，7 月份英国经济停滞不前，标志着第三季度经济开局不温不火。【原文：The UK economy stagnated in July, marking a tepid start to the third quarter as consumers and businesses face headwinds from tax rises and tariffs.】

item.title: 萨瓦德尔董事会认为 BBVA 180 亿美元的出价过低而予以拒绝
item.description: 萨瓦德尔银行（Banco Sabadell SA）董事会再次拒绝了西班牙对外银行（BBVA SA）180 亿美元的收购要约，认为该要约不够充分。【原文：Banco Sabadell SA’s board again rebuffed BBVA SA’s $18 billion takeover bid as insufficient, raising pressure on BBVA to improve it despite its vow not to do so.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国 7 月经济持平，工业生产下降
DeepMind 首席执行官称人工智能可将药物研发从数年缩短至数月
item.description: 发现新药需要数年时间，而且失败率高达天文数字。诺贝尔奖获得者、Alphabet 公司人工智能实验室负责人表示，这项技术很快将把时间缩短到一年以内。【原文：Discovering new medicines takes years and is marred by an astronomical failure rate. The Nobel Prize-winning head of Alphabet Inc.’s artificial intelligence lab says the technology will soon trim that time to under a year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员对利率看法不一，维勒鲁瓦称可能降息
item.description: 欧洲央行官员对利率的下一步行动提出了不同的看法，凸显出目前欧元区货币政策笼罩在不确定性的阴影之下。【原文：European Central Bank officials offered diverging views on the next step for interest rates, highlighting the sense of uncertainty overshadowing euro-zone monetary policy at present.】

item.title: 印尼扩大打击范围，接管矿山和棕榈油开采权
item.description: 印尼接管了超过 67.4 万公顷的棕榈油种植园，并查封了两个主要镍矿的部分矿区，在打击自然资源领域非法行为的同时，这个世界上最大的棕榈油和镍生产国的资产组合也在不断扩大。【原文：Indonesia has taken over more than 674,000 hectares of palm oil plantations and seized portions of two major nickel mines, handing the world’s top producer of both commodities a growing portfolio as it cracks down on illegal practices in the natural resources sector.】

item.title: 竞争对手苦苦挣扎，特拉菲古拉石油公司总裁称资产支撑利润
item.description: 创辉集团石油业务主管本-勒考克（Ben Luckock）表示，创辉集团最近对炼油厂和分销资产的投资有助于支持其石油业务，即使在竞争对手盈利能力下滑的情况下也是如此。【原文：Trafigura Group’s recent investments in refineries and distribution assets have helped support its oil business, even as rivals saw their profitability slide, according to the trader’s head of oil, Ben Luckock.】

item.title: 新加坡将于今年公布股东 "价值释放 "计划
item.description: 新加坡计划在今年晚些时候公布 "价值释放 "一揽子计划的细节，政府将采取进一步行动，提高人们对其股市的兴趣。【原文：Singapore plans to unveil details of a “value unlock” package later this year, as the government takes further action to boost interest in its stock market.】

item.title: 澳大利亚最大天然气出口厂获得最终批准，将运行至 2070 年
item.description: 澳大利亚第一家也是最大的液化天然气工厂通过了运营至 2070 年的最后一关，在这之前，运营商伍德赛德能源集团有限公司（Woodside Energy Group Ltd.）历经近七年的努力，但却遭到了环保人士和担心工厂污染的传统业主的反对。【原文：Australia’s first and largest liquefied natural gas plant cleared the final hurdle to operate until 2070, after an almost seven-year process during which operator Woodside Energy Group Ltd. faced opposition from environmentalists and traditional owners concerned about the site’s pollution.】
